content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

In Julia, you can define a function `clean_column` that performs the specified cleaning on column names. Here's how you can do it:

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    # Lowercase the string
    lc_str = lowercase(col)
    
    # Strip leading and trailing whitespace
    trimmed_str = strip(lc_str)
    
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    cleaned_str = replace(trimmed_str, r"\s|-" => "_")
    
    return cleaned_str
end
```

This function takes a string `col` as input and returns the cleaned version of the column name. It first lowercases the string, then strips any leading or trailing whitespace, and finally replaces spaces and hyphens with underscores.

You can use this function like so:

```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"
```

This will return "my_column" as the cleaned column name.
